subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Unicode Status
msgSnippet: ... Not in terms of Unicode, they re not. Your assertion is not more than an assertion. (I on the other hand have described the unification principles.) ...
messageBody:
On 16 Apr 2013, at 15:15, Jean-François Colson <jf@...> wrote:

> Le 16/04/13 14:32, Michael Everson a écrit :
>> The fact that there are two different sort orders for Shavian and Quikscript is kind of weird.
>
> That’s not weird. That’s only natural since Shavian and Quikscript are two separate scripts. That unification is completely artificial.

Not in terms of Unicode, they're not. Your assertion is not more than an assertion. (I on the other hand have described the unification principles.)

>> But I have to recommend where to interleave the new characters in the Shavian based ordering.
>
> Couldn’t you propose a new order for Quikscript? Different alphabets, different collation rules.

There is only one default template, and it is based on the Shavian order, so the new characters have to be inserted with regard to that. It is possible to specify other sorting orders, but for the default template, choices have to be made with regard to it.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
